alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 26 at 11:17PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania... including the following areas...in New Jersey...Mercer, Middlesex, and Somerset. In southeast Pennsylvania...Delaware, Eastern Montgomery, Lower Bucks, and Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms with locally heavy rain are are continuing across the watch area this late this evening. Widespread rainfall amounts of 1-2 inches with localized amounts of 3-4 inches have fallen. These totals have resulted in flash flooding, and additional flooding may be possible overnight. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
